website_summaries.verdict: A multifunction weather radio that alerts you to floods, tornados, thunderstorms, civil danger warnings, and more.
pros: This model scans through 7 available weather band channels and features super-loud alarms to alert you
(Specific Area Message Encoding) technology allows you to program alerts and warnings that are specific to your area
cons: AM reception is not the best and the included telescoping antenna can be awkward to position on smaller nightstands

customer_reviews.title: Cannot choose to only be alerted for tornado warnings. Watches are included in tornado setting.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, reliable weather radio. I'd have given it 5 stars if I could choose to only have alerts for actual tornado warnings. I don't want to be woken up for tornado watches, but I do want to be woken up when it's the more serious warning which means take cover. For those who aren't in tornado territory, watches can be frequent (several times a day for weeks) but don't usually become tornadoes. A warning means there is actual rotation and a tornado is pretty likely or an actual tornado has been sited in the area.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi I. Matthewman

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright Display (annoying), Excellent Audio quality, NOAA S.A.M.E database built-in
customer_reviews.text: This device has good sound quality and was easy to program. It does support NOAA S.A.M.E. Codes and has a built in database. Has a Volume control (A feature NOT included on the MIDLAND WR-120). Also has a built-in alarm clock and AM/FM radio making this unit seem perfect for the bedroom/bedside, however the light level of the display is WAY TO BRIGHT for any bedroom. The unit does feature display dimming feature with a single button controlling two levels: Bright and Dim. Even dimmed this unit produces too much light for a bedroom. (We solved the light problem with a small swatch of Dark Blue RoscoLux theater gel but not many people would have that around the house).
customer_reviews.author: LakeRat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and customize!
customer_reviews.text: This weather radio is great! It took a little time to fully customize the county codes and to select which alerts I wanted to activate the alarm. It wasn't complicated, but there were a few times you were referred to the NOAA website for codes. I was able to silence codes like flash flood warning, etc. that don't apply since I live on top of a hill. Also, you have the option to silence "watches" so you don't get unnecessary alarms in the middle of the night. Plus the alarm volume is adjustable. The weather radio always gives us an alert well in advance of the local news station. This is worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I started my review back a few weeks ago. A tornado had just gone by about 1/2 mile from my house and the alert never sounded, lit, nothing. I got a notification from my phone that there was a tornado on the ground. The test signal works, the clock works, to many bells and whistles for alerting someone of a tornado. Thankfully I still had cell service. It’s a pretty pricey alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Natures Retreat

customer_reviews.title: We live in the boonies
customer_reviews.text: We live in the boonies and can’t get regular tv or radio signals and that can be dangerous. There have been a slew of tornadoes in our area lately and we only knew bc family called us to tell us to seek shelter. We had three seek shelters in two days. I primed this and it has been a blessing. The alarm is my favorite feature and I can hear it anywhere in the house with loud kids playing. Get it. It’s wirth it. Your family and sanity are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tobehonest

customer_reviews.title: B
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these about six weeks ago. It lasted about a week before it drained the backup batteries and the sound stopped. I returned it and got up a replacement I had it for just about a month before I realized That I was not receiving any weekly test signals. After calling Midland and going over the possibilities they told me to return that one as well. I think that this new product has some bad parts of something. I did not get another one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lapham

customer_reviews.title: would not buy again...
customer_reviews.text: looks nice, eats backup batteries like its candy. Put clear tape over insanely LOUD speaker, as there is no volume control. Put cloth over display as the lowest setting is still too bright. But it does work.
customer_reviews.author: STW

customer_reviews.title: ... type unit but has the features you want and great reception. I live in a rural area so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the more expensive type unit but has the features you want and great reception. I live in a rural area so reception is important. it also does a great job of picking up normal radio stations so it's a good distance receiver for that sort of thing. It has the ability to turn off specific types of alerts so you can turn off everything but tornado's. We have had two alerts on it and it's loud enough to wake you up without waking the dead and making your ears bleed. Programming takes about 20 minutes give or take. For an item that could be the difference between life and death I don't see going the cheap option.
customer_reviews.author: slammer

customer_reviews.title: was nice getting the alerts ahead of
customer_reviews.text: Arrived right before Irma hit, was nice getting the alerts ahead of time
customer_reviews.author: dshep

customer_reviews.title: Really good weather alert radio.  Good alarm clock.  Ok radio.
customer_reviews.text: Great weather radio. The Good: * Can set the back-light to auto turn off. Great for having in your bedroom. Screen is readable when the backlight is off. * Good weather band reception * Has a nice alarm clock. Can either ring or play a radio station. Switch on the side lets you easily turn it on/off. * Can give it your county NOAA code so it only alerts you to local weather. * Can disable certain alerts. (I personally disable Thunderstorm Watch) The meh: * Can only have 3 preset stations each for FM and AM. The bad: * AM reception
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work.
customer_reviews.text: Just plain doesn't work for me. I have the WR400 in the window of my office and it has no reception. Since it didn't work I purchased an external antenna I have not tried the external antenna yet. I also have The WR120 it works ok 3/5 I have the WR120 in my bedroom, where works ok. This WR120 also works in my office. The WR400 doesn't work in my bedroom either. I have tried other weater radios. My general consensus of all weather radios I have tried are far less than optimal.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Hope I don't need it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. It took a little bit of time to get it set up correctly. Definitely worth having in our RV.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Not picking up weather stations
customer_reviews.text: The jury is out still....I can receive AM ok in my office (3 story brick building...I'm on the ground floor in the middle...no window) but I can't hear any of the NOAA weather stations despite a display showing 2 to 4 bars.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Both AM and FM reception is good however the weather bands do not receive as well as I would like. Thank goodness we sleep on the third level of our home so reception there is fair. Still only one weather station can be heard. My previous Midland would receive up to four in the same location. Also, not the easiest to program if you opt to leave the default mode. All in all it provides the protection I wanted. Hope this was helpful! Glenn Athens, AL
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: A home must
customer_reviews.text: I've been a weather enthusiast for years and have always had a handheld weather radio that blew your doors off with warning alarms so loud that it was really intrusive. Not only that, but they were warnings that didn't pertain to us (county flood warnings that were nowhere near us etc...) I wanted something customizeable to my needs and had a better volume control. The amount of customization and warnings offered is staggerring. The clock radio aspect is just a bonus. It's worked well and I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why we waited so long to get one
customer_reviews.text: We live just outside of Nashville Tennessee where we have a lot of storms. We moved here 15 years ago and have relied mostly on the tv for storm notifications. However, as of lately, we find ourselves not able to even turn on mainstream news channels due to the amount of you know what being spewed. So we mainly watch YouTube and Amazon Prime. This radio fills the gap perfectly. Its loud and to the point and if you miss an alert, it will repeat it, especially as the need becomes more pertinent. It’s definitely been a good purchase. Set up was easy and it has a battery backup for situations when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid, I expected a quality product. Programming is ridiculously annoying, and there is no way to verify your inputs were correctly saved except by going in an changing then again. Did it work this time? Who knows! I set an AM alarm, it didn’t go off. A flash flood watch was issued in the middle of the night. My cell phone alerted me, this thing didn’t. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe68

customer_reviews.title: Midland help support is AWESOME.  The radio is really great!!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a small town with 1 radio station. This radio has no problem receiving the stations from a larger city 75 miles away. I had a problem with receiving the emergency alerts but I moved it to the kitchen and had help from the support area at Midland. First bang out of the box it worked perfectly from then on. The help desk was awesome and she gave me her direct line if I continued having issues. She definitely knew my product and was very well versed on how these radios work to include programming. ❤️❤️ Love my radio!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Harris

customer_reviews.title: you get ehat you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Does not pick up weather station very well and we live only 20 miles away. Music stations play well. It loojs nice. It sits next to my bed and I just bumped the antenna with a small throw pillow making my bed in the morning and the antenna broke off half way down. I just pushed it back together. Problem is I hsd to push it in 3 inches to hold abd now antenna is shorter and now it doesnt pick up weather stations almost att all. It just says poor reception on screen.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use everyday, easy to program in the first place
customer_reviews.text: Reeeeeeally easy to program (i.e., de-select alerts). This was the downfall of first-generation weather alert radios: they went off every five minutes. So far, I've had no alerts in three days, although the NOAA signal strength meter is strong @ five bars (with the antenna fully collapsed and folded, mind you). Hope to be one of the first alerted in case of a volcano, or not so much a nuclear plant or radiological hazard, since I'm only 10 miles downwind, but too far to hear the sirens.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect device to find out about your weather alerts
customer_reviews.text: Love this device! Perfect for finding out about your local weather and keeping track of weather events. Just plug it in, set the time, and set your local staton (very important to pick the staton near your residence). When you do those steps, you are good to go.... Highly recommend the radio....
customer_reviews.author: John Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Works well for now
customer_reviews.text: Works well for now, however this was supposed to be brand new. When I received it, the box was in poor shape and the cord was unraveled. When programming the radio, it was already programed for New Jersey stations. It's unfortunate that you still get resold products on Amazon. This happens a lot more than we are aware I am afraid. Seems like the only way you can be sure your getting a brand new product is to go to the old fashion brick and mortar.
customer_reviews.author: MistrRN

customer_reviews.title: Great NOAA based weather alerting system when you need it
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a hot spot with frequent hazardous weather events this device is a must especially if you want regular updates have no cell service or cable. Sits idle most of the time but if a major NOAA weather event such as Tornado, Hurricane, blizzard occurs it alerts you with a sound and alert message of the event. Weather event alerts are configurable so you can select which events you what to be notified about. Has good NOAA signal reception even in double wall brick building with few windows. Easy to configure and can be plugged into wall outlet or taken with you and powered by batteries if you have to leave the area.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Everything but an OFF BUTTON!
customer_reviews.text: Why is there no OFF button? Lets say you have days of thunderstorms, flooding warnings, etc & this thing goes off every 5 or 10 minutes--for freaking days! So the only want to turn it off is to unplug it AND remove the batteries. Ether that or take a baseball bat to it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great weather radio, but can't view time from bed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. It has many useful features. I like the ability to turn off alerts that are not for my area. I added an external Sangean ANT-100 External Antenna but the unit picked up the local weather station without it. I added two 0.5 inch Cone Shaped Black Rubber Bumpers to the bottom back that lifted the radio so that I can view the time while laying in bed (-1 star). I would have liked it if used rechargeable batteries that would charge while in the radio (-2 stars for battery life). Overall I would recommend the Midland - WR400 weather radio
customer_reviews.author: KenSch888

customer_reviews.title: Midland Weather Radios - Why
customer_reviews.text: The radio was small, looked great but, was unable to pick up the frequency of our weather station in Fort Wayne, IN 20 miles from where we live. AM radio couldn't clearly pick up a radio station we listen to each morning without a lot to static and fading in and out. In the past we owned 2 of Midland's $29.99 white weather radios and each one of them quit working before we had them for 2 years. Its a mystery to me why they cannot build a better radio but, when they got idiots like me that keep buying them, why not? No more, no more Midland weather radios.....
customer_reviews.author: William M Wright

customer_reviews.title: Super Weather Radio
customer_reviews.text: Super weather radio. It goes off every time there is severe warnings to allow you time to react if needed. Only severe weather, not rain or wind. Also purchased the Midland 18-STR strobe light that helps with the warning. It flashes brightly and is a nice addition. Added the Sangean ANT-100 external antenna that helps pick up further distances. The weather radio also plays music and weather channels to listen to. Very nice product to own.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: This unit doesn't work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This unit is easy to set up and use, the only problem is it does not support the End Of Message (EOM) S.A.M.E signal which means that instead of turning on, delivering the Weather Alert, and turning off, it turns on, and stays on for 5 minutes and then shuts off. This is way too long for it to remain on when all you need to hear is whatever the emergency happens to be.
customer_reviews.author: AirThunder

customer_reviews.title: Received a dud!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older midland that I wanted to replace and thought I’d upgrade to this one. When it was first plugged in, it had an odd buzzing sound. It quickly faded away and then nothing at all would come from the speaker. No amount of volume changing would make it work. I sent it back and will try another one and then will update my review then.
customer_reviews.author: jBrooke

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Alert/Radio
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability to set it to my county and to adjust the tone of the alert. The radio sounds great! I live in an area where I don’t always hear the sirens, or they don’t go off in time. Living in tornado alley, it’s important at I have adequate warning - especially living in an apartment. Well worth getting this model over the less expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Tinker

customer_reviews.title: This radio works well and provides peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that we would have some warning if a severe storm was coming our way. It took a little time to set up the warnings (but is was easy) and to decide what counties around us I would like to use for the warnings as well. We have been using it for several months now and could not be happier. I just bought another one for my daughter so she could have some peace of mind too.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyD

customer_reviews.title: A great product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio as a gift for my husband to replace the Radio Shack junk we had paid way too much for. He is thrilled with this one for sure. Easy to program, and compact so as to not take up too much room on the night stand. I highly recommend this radio for anyone who wants not only am and fm but weather band also.
customer_reviews.author: graceforme

customer_reviews.title: WR-300 doesn't respond to EOM
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the WR-300. Received this unit and everything works well. SAME and tri-county functions works as expected. FM radio sound great. I'm not quite sure why manufactures have such a difficult time including the EOM function. I have two Radio Shack weather radios that are around 25 years old and both of them respond to the EOM. They are delegated to the bedrooms so we don't have to reset them each time they alert. I also have two WR-100's that are years old and function well. The WR-300 is a nice unit and would be a perfect unit if it responded to the EOM.
customer_reviews.author: ESS_guy

customer_reviews.title: Dud after three months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for all of three months, Got check reception after that. Put an external antenna on and nothing. Choose another brand for this important item
customer_reviews.author: M^2

customer_reviews.title: We Wouldn't be without one
customer_reviews.text: We live in tornado alley and a part of every household here should be a weather radio. We purchased this one after our old Midland gave out after 10+ years. It's about a five minute chore to set it up--if you're slow. It WILL wake you up from a sound sleep. We keep ours in the bedroom with the volume turned up to the max. We can hear it over the TV in the living room or anywhere in the house. Even when our town's siren system was out, we felt safe, because our Midland kept us informed. It's a life saving investment.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Lane

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact you can set it so that when ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact you can set it so that when an alert goes out, it doesn't just continuously sound the alert sound, but switches to the broadcast message. I don't like that you can't adjust how long it continues to sound that broadcast (5 minutes). My previous weather radio would continuously sound the alert tones until you pushed a button to silence them, which meant that I often missed part of the message. I also like that you can program it to ignore certain alert types.
customer_reviews.author: LJS566

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The radio is exactly as described. It was easy to set up and program. I was going to put it in my bedroom as I live in a high danger fire zone is California. The problem is I like to see what time it is should I wake up during the night. The radio design prevents the clock face from being seen. I bought the clock because it was highly recommended for its features so I decided to keep it and moved it into the den. To me it's weird to have to stand up to look at a clock.
customer_reviews.author: CathyV

customer_reviews.title: It just won't work.
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I kept my (near) 20 y/o model around, about a month ago I un-boxed the new model and programmed it...and immediately noted I was constantly seeing a check reception message. In the interest of curiosity (and personal safety) I set both units side-by-side as spring severe weather season began, the WR300 has a 100% rate of failure compared to the near 20 y/o Reecom unit that I purchased for $5 during a local promotion. I do not know if others have had problems but the Midland unit is only good for time/date and nothing else, buyer beware as this was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: BillyCz

customer_reviews.title: Alerts me when I need to know....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to replace a much older unit I had. The Midland was easy to program and the alert lets the house know when an event is occurring. It has different options for the alert, which I like. We have had several weather alerts since we bought it and it has done exactly what I bought it for. As noted, the sound quality is OK. For the alert - its great. For listening to the AM or FM radio - its a small desk radio - not surround sound. No complaints though: I highly recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is another great Midland product. Works as described. The black and white display is an improvement over the blue background display in other previous models. My only complaint is that after it alarms it cuts the broadcast off too early. Needs an optional setting to extend the voice broadcast as in previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Golfmann1

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: We had a tornado warning a couple months ago and it worked great and I could hear the warning from wherever I was in the house. It was pretty simple to program if you read the instructions. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't reset the time automatically when the time changes twice a year. Since all my other clocks automatically change it seems that the technology to do this is out there. I would give it 5 stars if it did this.
customer_reviews.author: CRTreeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Know your area
customer_reviews.text: Radio works well. Digital frequency is key to the problem I had with my old analog dial. Living in a valley area does not allow me to utilize the weather station for my exact area, (even by taking it outside). However that being said I can get what I need from a county outside of my own, but close enough to be somewhat effective. The one that I receive is in a different state, but I live on the border. I will call this "close, but no cigar" as they used to say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Time to bring this unit up to 2018! Cheaply made... cumbersome controls... have to turn radio off to get warnings... hope it works if I ever need it. Overall, not impressed. Poor quality, very cheap!
customer_reviews.author: David Oliver

customer_reviews.title: I guess I got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: I tried many different setups to recieve the messages but none worked in my area where I was recieving NOAA broadcast loud and clear. I live in Baton Rouge and a t/s just passed right over the top of us yet not one message was received. I kept trying different combinations but to no avail. I'm sending it back. I even checked to be certain this broadcast station was working properly and it is. I tried all on, all locations...nothing worked for messages. I liked the radio though.
customer_reviews.author: D.Windham

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weather radio. I've had the WR120EZ for years which is also a great radio. I was drawn to this one because of the addition of the AM/FM radio and the large screen. Sadly the speaker did not work on the first unit I received. I immediately contacted Midland Customer Service and they sent me out a new radio which arrived today and is in perfect working order! I am very pleased with my new radio and the customer support I received.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Milton

customer_reviews.title: Does not receive alerts
customer_reviews.text: 10 weather alerts have been issued the past week and the radio was silent. I have it set to receive all alerts in all areas. I have a scanner with a weather alert function tuned to the same Weather frequency and it alerted us. I Emailed costumer service and they were just as silent as the radio is. The AM reception has a loud hum on it if I use the cheap power supply that came with the radio. If the radio is just on battery power the hum goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Power cable did not work
customer_reviews.text: The device function on batteries, but not on AC power. I did not realize this, because I installed batteries (as backup) before setting up the device. Amazon's Customer service connected me with the Midland Corporation customer service (since I am beyond the "return" period). Midland is sending me a new power cable, so hopefully that will remedy the issue.
customer_reviews.author: August Roesener

customer_reviews.title: Midland WR300 battery backup and AC adaptor
customer_reviews.text: Works fine with built in antenna. Closest transmitter is about 20 miles out. Picture shows standard weekly test message. Just using default out of box settings. Have received both watches and warnings with alarm going off. It will wake you up!! Switches to voice announcing then in 5 minutes turns off alarm/voice leaving alert LED lit and warning time and expiration time on screen. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: supertech1789

customer_reviews.title: County codes in radio
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Menus not very intuitive. Good feature is that the county codes are already in the radio so all you have to do is have a map and select desired counties from a list. Would be nice if you didn't have to select the state each time through the menu. Should be able to select state and select multiple counties without going through the state selection process for each county.
customer_reviews.author: H.T. R.

customer_reviews.title: Good features but high failure rate
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these radios (WR300) over the last few years. Good features but high failure rate. All but one developed a high pitch squeal in the weather radio rendering the thing useless. I do not recommend purchasing Midland weather radios as they have a short life expectancy. Buyer beware. Deserves a minus star.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, works great
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for some time now and it works great. Its by my bedside. It has all the functions of a clock radio, dual alarms, light dim, etc. The weather function is great, loud alarm for alerts, clear speaker, easy setup. I am in the south where tornados are regular happenings. I would not be without a weather radio. Love it
customer_reviews.author: LadybugFarm97

customer_reviews.title: Very important to have this
customer_reviews.text: I love this alert radio. In the world we live in now its important to get emergency information. I love the way this radio will come on even if it is turned off to alert of weather emergencies in my area. I understand I could get the same information on the news but hey, I don't listen to news 24/7 so its nice to have this back up. I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Soquaint

customer_reviews.title: Good Weather Alert Radio
customer_reviews.text: Once programmed, this radio does a good job of providing severe weather alerts from the National Weather Service.The display and volume controls are adequate. I would have given it a higher overall rating, but the emergency programming procedure is way more complex than it has to be. That, along with very sketchy written instructions caused me to give it only a 3.
customer_reviews.author: William Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good volume and nice small size.
customer_reviews.text: I have the unit located on a window sill in the dining room and its nicely out of the way, yet the volume is good enough so hear in the master bedroom ... the beginning tone is loud enough to wake us up, and we can hear the announcement without having to get out of bed. I especially like the ability to let us get announcements from other counties ... we live very near the county line, so it's nice to know what's coming our way.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Darke

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Options
customer_reviews.text: This weather radio provides lots of options, including what alerts create sound and which don't. It is also nice to pick the geographic area(s) for these alerts. This allows you to choose the county in which you live, as well as surrounding counties if you wish for even more advanced notice. There are two sound levels; the louder of which I could hear outside our house, so it should wake us in the middle of the night if necessary. It's also relatively small size allows it to sit discretely on a shelf or counter.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdad

customer_reviews.title: Works at advertised, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Good display, have observed none of the end of message problems, nor any with the weekly tests. A bit pricey, but I've been disappointed in some of the other options. Works with external light alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Well made, fully functional early warning system
customer_reviews.text: This radio is well made, reception in my area is weak I may invest in an external antenna clock and alarm functions are easy to operate unlike previous Sony designed radios I have owned. The alert systems work as described in Amazon descriptions. The backlight display is really bright I shut it off in evenings or it lights up the room. Time indicator is small but readable from 3 feet away. I would recommend it for anyone looking for a solid advance warning of heavy weather with easy to operate controls and am fm capability. Very satisfied with my purchase just wish the light were adjustable and the time display a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Cheftype

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First unit would not work on AC power. Requested replacement, but I had the same issue. It appears that the port for the AC plug is broken. The second unit has been returned for a refund. I wish they would have worked correctly because it seemed to be a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Weather Radio!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best weather radio I have ever seen. Seems to be very good quality. Most importantly, you can turn off all the annoying alerts that wake you in the middle of the night that you do not want. You can choose alerts for your county and only the alerts that you want. I only left the tornado warning and severe thunderstorm warning. AND I turned off the AMBER alert that always seemed to go off at 3am. I highly recommend this radio
customer_reviews.author: D. Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Uniden weather radios
customer_reviews.text: I noticed there are reviews for other Uniden weather radios in this item's review string. Most reviews are not for the WR400. I'd say this one solved all the issues discussed in other reviews for earlier versions. It has excellent reception with an external antenna port, easy to program, easy to see screen. Really nice weather radio.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: PURCHASED FOR HURRICANE SEASON
customer_reviews.text: Decided to purchase a better quality weather radio after the last hurricane season. This Midland weather radio fit all our needs. Has an easy to read display window. Capable of customizing warnings (with adjustable volume) and has a good quality sound (not alot of static). Automatically switches from an AM/FM station (to its auto override) to warn you of hazardous conditions in your area.
customer_reviews.author: GZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Radio
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to customize, great reception. Setting backlight level to 1 allows dimmed display in bedside location without being too bright at night. Uses widely available AA batteries for backup when the power is out. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RMA

customer_reviews.title: Midland Weather Alert
customer_reviews.text: I am in a "poor reception" area and the radio (F/M - A/M) is practically useless. The set up could be easier, as I have to get the manual out to see what direction to go in with the arrows. The screen is difficult to see. The manual could be a little more explanatory with some of the settings as I did not know what they were talking about. I had to get on my computer to find out what channel I should set it on and then wasn't sure I had the right one. I think it works OK, but have not had it long enough to determine. I would not buy another unit like this.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: great weather radio
customer_reviews.text: This weather radio has many features; that is a good thing but it also requires a lengthy time of setting it up for your desired level & types of alerts. You will need to log onto a website on the internet to get the correct location code, then will have to go thru all hundreds of types of possible alerts on the radio to set whether you want to hear types of alerts on your radio. This is all worth it in the end as the result is your own personalized weather radio; just plan to take the time to go thru the process.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Martin

customer_reviews.title: I used this radio on my deck to listen to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this radio on my deck to listen to the news, but it has such limited range, it is hard to pickup am or fm stations and I am only 20 miles from the downtown location of most of the radio stations. In order to understand radio station WSB on 95.5 fm , you had to go to 95.4 and it still wasn't clear.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: The yellow weather watch light came on, and it show flood watch, but its not raining, there is no flood watch for this area. I checked the location programing and it's for the single location that I am at. I have an other unit, different make, and that one does not show flood watch. This unit is totally fake.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Very good weather radio BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this weather radio. It is overall pretty easy to configure. The only complaint I have is that there isn't a option to adjust the volume for the alert function. This is what kept me from giving it a 5 star rating. Outside of this I highly recommend this unit as a very good home or office weather alert radio.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great midland weather / emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Great for the home to monitor if something happens. I live in the country with no WIFI, internet or cell phone coverage sometimes. I'm in California so it's great for wildfires, flash floods,dam breaks. You can set it up to moniter specific counties so you don't hear stuff not related to you.
customer_reviews.author: Craig M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Poor shipping.
customer_reviews.text: The product is as advertised. Works well. Easy to program. The down side is the shipping. Just slapped a label in the product box and dropped it in the mail. For an electronic device, I would expect more care and packaging material. (The interior packaging did not include a foam insert or anything. Just a plastic bag over the device and a piece of cardboard.)
customer_reviews.author: The Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I do not like that when an alert sounds
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to set up. I do not like that when an alert sounds, the voice keeps giving weather for another 5 minutes....very annoying during the night. This is a replacement for an old Radio Shack alert radio....that used to turn off after the alert, and message. The display is a bit difficult to see, and some of the display is too small to read. I get good reception in my location. I should have done more shopping, or more research.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: This One Gives Weather Alerts
customer_reviews.text: This model replaced a WR120EZ alert radio, which turned out to be a big disappointment because it struggled to receive any kind of radio signal. I use this WR400 for weather alerts and broadcasts only. I can't attest to its effectiveness as an AM/FM radio or alarm clock since I don't use those functions. I needed a good, dedicated weather radio and I found what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Tim N.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality weather radio
customer_reviews.text: This weather radio is good quality and is easy to program for your specific area. The backlight for the display is also adjustable and even has a "night" setting, although it is still bright enough to bother someone who prefers total darkness in the room to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Blasterman

customer_reviews.title: Great weather radio.  Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I give this weather radio five stars for its ease of setup and functionality. Delivery was swift, as expected, very fast. We have plenty of tornadoes in north Texas which requires a reliable, quality weather radio that works. Out of the box, on battery, it brought in the NOAA and FM stations clearly. It was very easy to program with S.A.M.E. county code and weather channel. Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo627

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio -- exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase so far. It was packaged well and received on time as promised. It was easy to set up, the instructions were clear and it fits nicely on a bedside table. The audio is excellent and the ability to choose the type of alarm is great. I recommend this radio for anyone who needs a weather band and AMFM combination.
customer_reviews.author: Mary  (N.C.)

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT! HIGHLY SUGGEST!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great condition, opened the box setup was so easy. It’s bigger than I expected and I love it. The screen is great, volume and clarity is outstanding! Such great signal strength and it looks great! The alert is so loud. I love that you can turn off all the alerts you do not want to here!
customer_reviews.author: BlazingTomcat101

customer_reviews.title: An excellent clock radio for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is of extraordinary value. I wanted a weather radio along the FM/AM frequencies. I can’t rate the battery life as I just received the unit today. The sound is excellent and the unit draws in programming of local and surrounding frequencies. (I’m just west of Chicago. )
customer_reviews.author: dlj

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and I can here the warning from my bedroom with the door closed.
customer_reviews.author: PamelaNSL

customer_reviews.title: Kills battereis even when plugged in
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if the one I got for Christmas is broken but batteries only lasts one or two days even though I have it plugged into 110. I doubt it would last even one day if unplugged.. I sent an email to the company about the battery problem but they have never responded back. I would NOT recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Neal

customer_reviews.title: Not an emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Two issues: #1 because this is a clock the batteries run down within a few days. #2 the USB charger works only with the AC adapter, so what good is it if the power is off and you want to charge your phone? You are better off getting a radio without the clock feature. If power is off for more than a week this thing is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Jarman

customer_reviews.title: Great weather alert Radio
customer_reviews.text: A great weather alert radio that also has two programmable alarms and am/fm radio. The radio is digitally tuned and has four presets for both am and fm bands; no station drift. All of the functions are menu driven and can be customized to suit.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Display could be much better
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Weather radio and alerts work. You can wake to weather radio. Cons: 1. Clock is worthless as a nightstand clock. Time display is tiny and not lit enough to see at night. 2. Programming results in very annoying beeps with each change. 3. Uses 4 AA batteries, not a 9 volt, and goes through them
customer_reviews.author: Picky Dad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that it does not have the auto off after the emergency message is announced. This unit plays for 5 minutes after announcing event
customer_reviews.author: James A McCrory Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great weather/ radio to have
customer_reviews.text: Great little weather radio with battery back up - perfect for hurricane season and our occasion tornado activity
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful while it worked. Emergency notifications are handy and work well. You can set it up with a local code (SAME) so you don't receive unnecessary notifications. The problem is the weather radio and alerts stopped working after about 5 years. The AM/FM radio still works fine but that's not what I bought this for. Checking around the internet, this seems to be a pretty common problem with this unit. I was lucky to get five years,
customer_reviews.author: Al S.

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Weather Radio
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Midland WR300 for about six months. I bought it to replace another brand that I didn't like. The programming wasn't too difficult and I really like the SANE programming. I receive only specific alerts for my county. The only complaint I have is not with Midland but with NOAA. I live in a large county and I get Severe Thunderstorm Warnings and Tornado Warnings for storms in the extreme northern part of my county that I never even see. NOAA needs more codes to divide large counties into sections.
customer_reviews.author: George Miller

customer_reviews.title: No reception
customer_reviews.text: Radio worked great for me for a couple years but for the last year+ it has had a "check reception" error message. The radio still works but only if I manually turn it on; it does not alert me when there is a storm coming. I tried every possible fix in the user manual and continue to receive the error. I emailed Midland's technical support team and no one replied.
customer_reviews.author: PenName

customer_reviews.title: Great product but I had reception issues.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 10 year old WR300 radio that was not receiving the required weekly check. I bought the same model thinging that my problem as a defective radio. The WR-300 model I received had the same reception issue. I contacted Midland and they sent me a WR-400 to see if that radio would work better. It did, so I returned the WR-300 to Amazon with no difficulty. Great Amazon service. I recommend spending the additional $10 and get the WR-400.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month and it seems to work as advertised. My only complaints are that the clock seems to run a little slow and the display is a little too bright. It has a dimmer but is too bright even on its low setting. It's in the bedroom so in the middle of the night the light is noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J Camera

customer_reviews.title: Very Complicated Set-up
customer_reviews.text: Extremely complicated set-up instructions. I thought it would be a good idea to have this. After having it for 7 years, the only thing I can say about it is that it's woken me unnecessarily on several occasions. I tried to re-set it recently and gave up after about 1/2 hour. Way too complicated! Guess I'll just have to take my chances and hope that my house doesn't get hit by a tornado in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: nice weather  alert radio
customer_reviews.text: i have not had the chance to hear it go off at my home yet, no bad weather sence got it, but i will say it works great, from hearing the weather on it., now on the (07) of november, i got the chance to hear it work in bad weather, , this is a great weather alert radio. , that is why i am giving it a 5 star, i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Marvin Harris

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, and sound quality is good. Have it set to turn on during emergencies only, and has gone off once or twice for that reason. Need to suggest to replace the backup batteries every year. Does not let you know they are running down, and had to clean the terminals because of this. But still a very good radio.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: have 2 now one in bedroom and one in living room and it alerts to storms and amber alerts fine
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio as well as NOAA weather warning
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio as well as NOAA weather warning . Reception has been great from an interior wall in my home for both regular AM/FM reception as well as NOAA. One thing, read the instructions and you will set up an excellent weather warning device!
customer_reviews.author: Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few minutes to set up
customer_reviews.text: I love it! You can set up to 25 locations and control what alerts will wake you up at 3 in the morning. Warnings only cause alarm to sound, advisories and watches just blink. Alarm clock doesn’t work on mine, but that doesn’t matter to me. Very easy set up. And don’t get alarmed if you don’t see tornado warning or hurricane warning. They are preset to be on at all times along with many other alerts. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted and expected from Midland
customer_reviews.text: I really like this; as an AM/FM radio and as an alarm clock but mostly its weather alert programming flexibility and one-touch current conditions for my area and specific home town. Its exactly what I wanted. I’ve tested the programming and found the instructions provided/included to be clear and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: Solid performance with regional programming! Selectable warnings, watches, and advisories! Battery backup is perfect & essential!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Programable to turn off unwanted alerts.
customer_reviews.text: I took a hammer to the last one (different brand) I had because it keep resting and would go off all the time. This one if programmed right it will not go off all the time. I have it programmed to only go off to 3 things. It lights up for the other warnings. It goes off we i need it to and not other time!
customer_reviews.author: CSK

customer_reviews.title: NOAA weather
customer_reviews.text: I don’t always have my phone on me and i don’t have my television hooked up and no internet so it’s nice to have a peace of mind that will blade off any signs of problems if I’m in the house to where i pay attention. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: BSmith

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my sis who lives without tv.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It works and is loud and clear. Picks up well with the provided antenna out in rural KY. The initial setup is a lil tricky if I remember correctly. Been a while. Still ticking away. Now I have peace of mind. Knowing they're informed in the event of severe weather. The only thing I dislike is the high price. However should it last years then I'm fine. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good, volume control and battery life as well. We live in the middle of the country and it eases my mind to have this weather radio if power goes out during a storm in case of tornado.
customer_reviews.author: Delania Bringle

product_meta.title: Midland - WR400, Deluxe NOAA Emergency Weather Alert Radio - S.A.M.E. Localized Programming, 80+ Emergency Alerts, & Alarm Clock w/ AM/FM Radio
product_meta.description:
Style:WR400 - Deluxe NOAA Weather RadioThe WR400 is Midland’s most advanced emergency weather alert radio. This NOAA Weather Alert Radio can help you be prepared for all types of emergency threats including tornadoes, floods, severe thunderstorms, civil danger warnings and more. When a severe weather watch or warning is issued by the National Weather Service, the WR400 automatically alerts you, giving you the seconds you need to seek shelter. The WR400 is capable of receiving 7 National Oceanic & Atmospheric Association (NOAA) channels. It is also programmed with over 80 alerts like hurricanes and flash flooding. The SAME localized reception allows users to program the radio to sound an alert only when weather and other emergencies threaten a selected county or counties. The technology eliminates all alerts from other areas, so users won't have to perk up their ears each time the alert sounds only to find the emergency is actually 100 miles up the highway. It stores up to 10 different previously received all hazards and weather alerts. The WR400 also features: color-coded alert level indicators, 85 dB siren, USB output to charge devices, AM/FM radio, 4 preset radio buttons, and a continuous backlighting option that keeps the LCD on. The WR400 is public alert certified and is backed by a one-year warranty. This product is recommended by the Department of Homeland Security for Emergency Preparedness.

SET CONTAINS:
WR400 Emergency Alert Weather Radio, AC Power Adapte and Owner's Manual
feature_bullets: NOAA WEATHER SCAN + ALERT - NOAA Weather Scan will automatically scan through 7 available weather (WX) band channels with flood, tornado, thunderstorm, civil danger warnings, and more. It also locks onto the strongest weather channel to alert you of severe weather updates. NOAA Weather Alert will sound an alarm indicating that there is a risk of severe weather hazards and emergencies in your area.

PROGRAMMING - S.A.M.E. - The Specific Area Message Encoding automatically locks on to your county’s NOAA weather radio signal requiring minimal programming from the user. CUSTOM - Program your radio to receive weather alerts/warnings from up to 25 different counties and be alerted only when those specific counties are threatened.
WARNING SYSTEM OPTIONS - Customize the way that you would like to be alerted: 85 dB siren alarm, voice alert, or visual LED flasher.
EMERGENCY POWER BACK UP - The 4 “AA” Alkaline batteries (Not Included) keeps your radio operating during power outages or outside use.

ALARM CLOCK - The built-in clock features an alarm with a snooze button and a AM/FM Radio. Wake up to local weather, AM/FM, or buzz. It automatically switches from AM/FM to pertinent all-hazard alerts..
